conclusion: To determine the accelerations of Car A and Car B over the time interval from t = 0 to t = t1, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.

The x-axis represents time (t). The y-axis represents velocity (v). The graph shows two curves labeled A and B. Curve A starts at v2 at t = 0 and decreases to v1 at t = t1. Curve B starts at v1 at t = 0 and increases to v2 at t = t1.

Acceleration (a) is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time. Mathematically, it can be expressed as: a = dv/dt. On a velocity-time graph, the slope of the tangent at any point gives the instantaneous acceleration at that point.
From t = 0 to t = t1, the slope of curve A becomes less steep. This indicates that the rate of decrease of velocity is slowing down. Therefore, the acceleration of Car A is decreasing over time.
From t = 0 to t = t1, the slope of curve B becomes steeper. This indicates that the rate of increase of velocity is increasing. Therefore, the acceleration of Car B is increasing over time.
The magnitude of the acceleration of Car A gradually decreases. The magnitude of the acceleration of Car B gradually increases.
